```
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ % bun install -g start-command                      
bun add v1.2.20 (6ad208bc)

installed start-command@0.7.0 with binaries:
 - $

1 package installed [2.40s]
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ % $ --version --              
Error: No command provided
Usage: $ [options] [--] <command> [args...]
       $ <command> [args...]

Options:
  --isolated, -i <environment>      Run in isolated environment (screen, tmux, docker)
  --attached, -a            Run in attached mode (foreground)
  --detached, -d            Run in detached mode (background)
  --session, -s <name>      Session name for isolation
  --image <image>           Docker image (required for docker isolation)
  --version, -v             Show version information

Examples:
  $ echo "Hello World"
  $ npm test
  $ --isolated tmux -- npm start
  $ -i screen -d npm start
  $ --isolated docker --image node:20 -- npm install

Features:
  - Logs all output to temporary directory
  - Displays timestamps and exit codes
  - Auto-reports failures for NPM packages (when gh is available)
  - Natural language command aliases (via substitutions.lino)
  - Process isolation via screen, tmux, or docker

Alias examples:
  $ install lodash npm package           -> npm install lodash
  $ install 4.17.21 version of lodash npm package -> npm install lodash@4.17.21
  $ clone https://github.com/user/repo repository -> git clone https://github.com/user/repo
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ % $ --version                 
start-command version: 0.7.0

OS: darwin
OS Release: 24.6.0
Node Version: v24.3.0
Architecture: arm64

Isolation tools:
  screen: not installed
  tmux: not installed
  docker: Docker version 28.5.1, build e180ab8
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ % screen -v
Screen version 4.00.03 (FAU) 23-Oct-06
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ % docker -v
Docker version 28.5.1, build e180ab8
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ % sw_vers
ProductName:		macOS
ProductVersion:		15.7.2
BuildVersion:		24G325
konard@MacBook-Pro-Konstantin ~ % 
```

The problems are:

- `screen` tool version was not detected.
- We use Bun, not Node.js (double check that, and also remove suggestions to install it using npm in the docs. Our tool should be Bun first and Bun only. For all scripts and shebangs we should use bun, not node. So in `--version` there should be bun version, not `node.js` version.
- OS version detection was wrong.
- `$ --version --` should work the same as `$ --version`, only `$ --` or `$` should result in `No command provided`.

Make sure we have tests for all these (and these tests should be executed in CI, so we guarantee the quality). Also [REQUIREMENTS.md](https://github.com/link-foundation/start/blob/main/REQUIREMENTS.md) should be updated as needed.

Please download all logs and data related about the issue to this repository, make sure we compile that data to `./docs/case-studies/issue-{id}` folder, and use it to do deep case study analysis (also make sure to search online for additional facts and data), in which we will reconstruct timeline/sequence of events, find root causes of the problem, and propose possible solutions.
title: --version issues
